definition: to abandon oneself to despair/to give up and stop bothering
to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away

sentences.english: From now on days of A letter is whole excessive drinking, abandonment.
sentences.chinese: 從此阿信整日酗酒，自暴自棄。

sentences.english: That is the syndrome. It is self- defeating and self-sabotaging.
sentences.chinese: 這就是“新一年決策綜合症”，是自暴自棄的敗筆。

sentences.english: Prisoners are women, it seems as persona non grata, give up on themselves to become.
sentences.chinese: 犯人是名女性，好像因爲不受歡迎，而變得自暴自棄。

sentences.english: But the process of surrendering oneself begins with small matters.
sentences.chinese: 但一個人自暴自棄的過程，總是從小的事情開始。

sentences.english: Looking back, I realize it was nothing but self-sabotage.
sentences.chinese: 追憶過去，我意識到那隻不過是自暴自棄罷了。

sentences.english: DESPERATE】She became so desperate that we feared for her sanity.
sentences.chinese: 她變得如此自暴自棄，使我們擔心她的神智。

sentences.english: Those who abandon themselves will not success.
sentences.chinese: 那些自暴自棄的人無法成功。
如果你沒有自暴自棄的話。

definition: satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to follow the track of an overturned cart/to repeat a disastrous policy
cannot figure out/to be unable to take a lighter view/to take things too hard/to be depressed/to fret over trifles
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
to force someone to do something
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
